dialog.text: Hello. The seeker  is feeling well. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to feel forward momentum and to focus on positive things.
Hi, how are you?

Thanks for asking. To be honest, I am very depressed recently. The seeker  is feeling depressed because of the news. The supporter could tell the seeker to get support from professional services or self-help groups.
Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that. What happened?

It is about helping to raise my grandson and his dad is not helping at all. His dad doesn't care about my feelings and I really start to feel it difficult taking care of kids. I'm losing my patience. The seeker  feels completely out of pocket and scared. The supporter could provide more information about the seeker's situation.
I'm sorry to hear that, and I understand how you feel. It's hard when your loved ones don't take your feelings into consideration.
beam_texts: I'm sorry to hear that, and I understand how you feel. It's hard when your loved ones don't take your feelings into consideration.

dialog.text: Yes, it is frustrating and depressing. The seeker  is depressed because she is struggling to overcome a lot of challenges in her life and she is message the supporter. The supporter could tell her to think about why she is feeling down and to try to find an answer.
I think it would help to try to talk to them about it, so they understand how you feel.
beam_texts: I think it would help to try to talk to them about it, so they understand how you feel.

dialog.text: I have tried that but it is like talking to a brick wall. The seeker  feels overwhelmed with school and does not have any response to the supporter. The supporter could ask the seeker to have a conversation with her parents or friends.
I understand how that feels, I also have been having a lot of problems in school lately and it feels like everyone else is just doing everything and I am just there.
beam_texts: I understand how that feels, I also have been having a lot of problems in school lately and it feels like everyone else is just doing everything and I am just there.

dialog.text: I'm so sorry. It is so hard when you feel like you are being left out. The seeker  is feeling sad and reducing the support to offer is overwhelming. The supporter could do something to help the seeker like telling her a story or providing support in a different way.
It really is, have you tried to talk to your friends about it?
beam_texts: It really is, have you tried to talk to your friends about it?

dialog.text: Yes, I have but they don't really understand. The seeker  feels like she is being left out and frustrated because she feels that her friends don't care. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to talk to her friends about her problem.
I understand how you feel, maybe you should try to talk to your parents or other family members about it as well.
beam_texts: I understand how you feel, maybe you should try to talk to your parents or other family members about it as well.

dialog.text: I have and they don't really understand. The seeker  feels like she is alone in her feelings. The supporter could offer some solutions for her to discuss with her friends.
I understand how you feel about that, maybe you should try to talk to a professional about it as well.
beam_texts: I understand how you feel about that, maybe you should try to talk to a professional about it as well.

dialog.text: I will do that. The seeker  is crying because she is feelingpressured from her friends to do things with her grandson. The supporter could help the seeker to ask for help from friends or professionals.
I hope it will help you and I hope you feel better.
beam_texts: I hope it will help you and I hope you feel better.

dialog.text: Thank you. The seeker  feels like she is not being supported and that people do not care about her feelings. The supporter could tell the seeker to try to talk to her parents or other family members about her feelings. The supporter could also tell the seeker to try and find a professional therapy.
You are welcome.
Have a good day. The seeker  is feeling better and has tried to talk to her friends about her problem. The supporter could tell her to try and find a support group.
You too.
I will. The seeker  is crying because she is feeling Academic Pressures. The supporter could tell the seeker to try and get professional therapy to help her overcome the academic pressure.
Goodbye.

Goodbye. The seeker  feels down and frustrated because he or she is having trouble with exams. The supporter could tell the seeker to try and talk to their friends or family about the feeling. The supporter could also tell the seeker to try and talk to a professional about the feeling.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. The seeker  is crying because of her friends not helping her with her project. The supporter should ask for more information about why the seeker is crying.
Goodbye.

Goodbye. The seeker  feels sad because she is struggling to overcome obstacles in her life and is good for one thing - her grandson. The supporter could tell the seeker to try and overcome the obstacles together.
Goodbye.

Goodbye.

Goodbye.

Goodbye.
